title: Instructional Design for Enhancing Counting Skills in 3-Year-Olds: Mobile Microlearning-Based Practical Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Child Development Theories and Basic Concepts in Mathematics Education
context.additional_context: Enhancing Educational Strategy Design and Evaluation Capabilities to Improve 3-Year-Old Children’s Counting Principles (One-to-One Correspondence, Order Irrelevance, etc.)

learning_goals: Acquisition of methods to measure counting ability changes in 3-year-olds using pre-post assessment designs
Design five or more specific educational activities to reinforce the one-to-one correspondence principle and order irrelevance principle

Learners analyze cognitive/physical developmental traits by age group (10–12, 13–15, 16–19) to develop ≥3 age-appropriate educational strategies (e.g., visual learning tools, project-based activities, self-directed tasks), applying them to ≥2 corporate programs and achieving ≥80% participant satisfaction.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
